subject: log4j classloader issue
msgSnippet: Yes its this one again when using 3.8.1 log4j:ERROR A org.apache.log4j.FileAppender object is not assignable to a org.apache.log4j.Appender variable.
messageBody:
Yes its this one again when using 3.8.1

log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.FileAppender" object is not assignable
to a "org.apache.log4j.Appender" variable.
log4j:ERROR The class "org.apache.log4j.Appender" was loaded by
log4j:ERROR [junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader@61736e] whereas object
of type
log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.FileAppender" was loaded by
[sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader@12f6684].

I know this has been raised before but there is no definitive fix
detailed. The log4j FAQ says that this should be fixed by the change
to excluded.properties in the 3.8.1 release but it still has the error.

A message to this list suggested trying to get the system classloader
to load log4j by referencing log4j in the main method but when just
writing Tests the main method is inside JUnit.

The textui works fine but the swinggui does not.
Thanks for any help as I enjoy the greeen bar.
Stuart.
